title: Partical motion - find velocity from position

content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis so that at time t > 0 its position is given by x(t) = 12e−tsin t. What is the first time t at which the velocity of the particle is zero?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
